text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Maltese press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Europe Union sees Malta undecided on EU membership. EU external relations commissioner Hans Van den Broek arrived in Malta on Monday for a 24-hour visit to discuss a new framework of relations between the EU and Malta following the island's decision to freeze its application to join the bloc.

- Shadow Finance Minister expects government revenue to drop under new system of indirect taxation. John Dalli, speaking in Parliament when it started debating a new system to replace VAT, said the government had not issued any projections on the revenue it expected from the new system but his calculations showed a drop to about 80 million Maltese pounds ($21m approx).
- Two young men arraigned over hold-up at a branch of Bank of Valletta last week when some $55,000 was stolen. It was later recovered by the police.
